definition: to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to begin/to start/then/only then
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
end/finish

sentences.english: But the pricing difficulty remains and this program too may amount to little.
sentences.chinese: 可是定价的困难依然存在，这个项目也会有始无终。

sentences.english: One is to do things badly and do not respect other people better.
sentences.chinese: 一个是做事情有始无终，不尊重别人嘛。

sentences.english: The man who forms the habit of beginning without finishing has simply formed the habit of failure.
sentences.chinese: 有了有始无终的习惯，就是有了失败的命定。

sentences.english: Doing what does not all start, but to carry it through.
sentences.chinese: 做什么事都不要有始无终。

sentences.english: As if that field peter love.
sentences.chinese: 犹如那场有始无终的爱情。

definition: to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth/to carry things through/I started, so I'll finish.
brief period of enthusiasm/flash in the pan
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
indecisive/irresolute
to procrastinate
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
without one's own opinions
lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3
